item.description: Release of Processing 1.0 (ALPHA)!
A new release of Processing has been posted for the alpha testers. This version fixes several bugs (particularly on OS X) and adds a few fine features.
32 additional examples posted.
A new typeface designed by Mike Cina of WeWorkForThem is integrated into the website. Other typefaces from Mike are available at YouWorkForThem.
New software from Schoenerwissen added to the software section and sixteen additional examples posted including new work from barragan, mescabosa, forkinsocket, and REAS.

A new release of Processing alpha (revision 46) is now available for testing. It fixes several of the worst Mac OS X problems and stability under Windows has improved. A few new features have been added as well.
New software from Reed Kram added to the software section.
New software from Nikita Pashenkov added to the software section and new work from Manny Tan and Casey Reas posted for the Singlecell project.
New software from Glen Murphy added to the software section.

Two recent updates to the Processing 1.0 (ALPHA) mean that we're now at revision 48. The latest release adds colored code, fixes to many of the bug reports from testers, and more mac tweaks to bring it up to par under OS X.
New software from Boris Müller and Golan Levin added to the software section and eighteen additional examples posted including new work from pcho, mescabosa, forkinsocket, and REAS..
Twenty-three additional examples posted including new work from James Patterson, Zach Lieberman, and REAS.
New software from William Ngan added to the software section and a few additional examples posted including new work from James Patterson, Joshua Nimoy, and REAS.

Welcome Hernando Barragán, Marc Escobosa, and Mathias Dahlström to the Processing development team. New examples posted including new work from Mike Davis and Glen Murphy. Name change—the project formally known as "Proce55ing" is now simply "Processing". The URL, however, confusingly remains the same.

Welcome Carlos Rocha to the Processing development team. Processing 1.0 (ALPHA) #52 is released which means the addition of transparent/antialiased polygons, improved functions for text output, and enhanced camera control. The number of Discussion Board members is approaching 300.
New software from Josh On added to the software section.
Processing 1.0 (ALPHA) #53 is released. Improved code for anti-aliasing graphics and a fix for the mysterious "disappearing caret" bug.
New software from Ed Burton added to the software section. The reference section is completely updated and a new technical notes section is added.
New software from Marius Watz added to the software section.
Processing 1.0 (ALPHA) #55 is released. Includes code for audio, video, and networking.
New software from GroupC and Carlos Andres Rocha added to the software section.
New software from Lia and Manny Tan added to the software section.
Processing 1.0 (ALPHA) #58 is released. Many updates to the environment and additions to the language.
Processing 1.0 (ALPHA) #60 is released. Significant changes to the language and a swarm of bug fixes.
Processing in Japanese. Tetsu Kondo updates the Japanese Processing reference.
Processing 1.0 (ALPHA) #65 is released. We're getting closer!
Processing in Hebrew. Heidi Cropp and Ariel Malka release http://www.processing.co.il.
New software from Amit Pitaru added to the exhibition section.
Processing 1.0 (BETA) #66 is released.
New software from Elise Co added to the exhibition section.

Sound and Tablet! Amit Pitaru has released the first two Processing external libraries. Sonia integrates Processing and the JSyn audio library. It requires the JSyn plugin to run from the web, but has a superior sound quality to the default Processing library.Wacom tablet interface provides access to the pressure and tilt data from a tablet.
Processing 1.0 (BETA) #67 is released.
New software from Jared Tarbell added to the exhibition section.
We're feeling lucky. Typing "Processing" into Google and clicking the "I'm Feeling Lucky" button will now take you here!
New software from Matthew Jogan and Julia Stanat added to the exhibition.
Proce55ing.net has been joined by Processing.org. Two domains, the same great taste.
New software from Brendan Dawes added to the exhibition.

Processing 1.0 (BETA) #68 is released and fixes a number of bugs which crash the application. Watch for a major release in a few months. It will increase the functionality of the programming environment and will add a new system for extending the language.
New Libraries section added to the reference. As of release #69, Libraries will make it easier for people to extend Processing with their own code.
New software from Mikkel Koser added to the exhibition.
Processing lecture at San Francisco Art Institute and presentation for Krister Olsson's course. We also had the pleasure of meeting Joshua Kit Clayton of Cycling'74, author of Jitter.
New software from Toxi added to the exhibition.

Indonesian Reference pages completed by Widianto Nugroho. These are the first finished reference pages built with our online reference translation scripts. I hope many more will follow soon. If you'd like to help translate write to reas at groupc.net.
New software from Jonah Brucker-Cohen added to the exhibition.
Reference for Sonia is now online! Sonia is created by Amit Pitaru and integrates the Jsyn Java audio library into Processing.
New software from Ryan Alexander added to the exhibition.
Korean Reference pages completed by Soni Park of the Art Center Nabi and with Tae-Kyung Kim.
Processing website initiative. Frederico Oliveira, Kevin Cannon, Widianto Nugroho, Glen Murphy, Martin Gomez, and Casey Reas have formed a team to improve the Processing website.
New software from Francis Lam and Henry Chu added to the exhibition.
New software from Alessandro Capozzo added to the exhibition.
New software from Mario Klingemann added to the exhibition.
New software from Ariel Malka added to the exhibition.

The Chinese reference is complete! Translated by the talented William Ngan, Tori Tan, and Mei Yu. Tremendous effort has gone into this accomplishment. These translations are added to the Japanese, Korean, and Indonesian translations.
New software from Katya Moorman added to the exhibition.
The French reference is complete! Thanks to Julien Gachadoat (v3ga). This is the first translation into a European language and we hope more will follow.
Five new Libraries added to the site. Learn how to export DXF and Illustrator files, how to communicate with other devices via OSC, and how to write simple graphic controllers for your software.
New software from David Crawford added to the exhibition.
The Spanish reference is complete! This adds 400,000,000+ potential Processing users. Translated by Pedro Alpera.
The Italian reference is complete! Traduzione dall'inglese a cura di Alessandro Capozzo.
The Turkish reference is complete! Translated by Burak Arikan.
New software from Krister Olsson (with sound by Yoshi Sodeoka) added to the exhibition.
New software from Justin Manor added to the exhibition.
Who owns our (software) culture? A panel at ISEA 2004 with Miller Puckette, creator of MAX and PD, and Casey Reas, co-founder of Processing. Moderated by Juha Huuskonen.
Processing is presented at the Dorkbot City Camp in Aarhus Denmark.
Processing is featured on the Danish radio program Harddisken. Interview by Thomas Birch and Thomas Markussen.
New software from Frederik Vanhoutte added to the exhibition.
Processing is featured at Interact1 in London.
New software from v3ga and Lucas Kuzma added to the exhibition.
Processing in Hong Kong. Workshop by Casey Reas at the City University of Hong Kong in association with the Microwave International Media Art Festival. Thank you Fion!
New software from Andreas Gysin and Gabriel Dunne added to the exhibition.
New software from Justin Bakse & Eric Williams added to the exhibition.
Over 25,000 people have now signed up to download the Processing software.
New software from Limiteazero added to the exhibition.
New software from Daniel Rothaug added to the exhibition.
New software from Enrico Bravi, Mikkel Crone Koser, and Paolo Palma added to the exhibition.
New software from Ji-Hoon Byun and E.G. Gone added to the exhibition.
New software from Allan William Martin added to the exhibition.
Ben Fry and Casey Reas present Processing for the Tokyo TDC.
New software from Ichitaro Masuda added to the exhibition.
Ben Fry, Casey Reas, Robert Hodgin, Jared Tarbell present at FITC, Toronto.
The Processing (BETA) is now available for download. This is the first public release. We're excited.
Two new libraries contributed from Tatsuya Saito. Google API interfaces with the Google search engine and OBJ Loader makes it easy to load 3D files.
Processing (BETA) 86, 87 released, fixing some nice bugs found in the original (BETA) release.
BlobDetectionlibrary contributed by v3ga. Performs the computer vision technique of finding "blobs" in an image.
New software from Martin Wattenberg added to the exhibition.
Obsessive Camera Directionlibrary contributed by Kristian Linn Damkjer. MySQLlibrary contributed by Florian Jenett. Oscillatorlibrary contributed by Taka.
Processing (BETA) 88, 89 released, fixing additional nice bugs found in the original (BETA) release.
Processing (BETA) 90 released.
Ess sound library contributed by Krister Olsson.
Processing (BETA) 91 released.
New software from Tom Carden, Clayton Cubitt, and Marius Watz added to the exhibition.
Many new examples from Dan Shiffman added to Learning.
New software from Robert Hodgin added to the exhibition.
Net Library reference augmented with examples from Tom Igoe.
New software from Michael Chang added to the exhibition.
New software from Alison Mealey added to the exhibition.
New software from Martin Ignacio Bereciartua added to the exhibition.
New software of Osman Khan added to the exhibition.
The subdomain hardware.processing.org is launched! Features links to the Wiring and Arduino initiatives.
The subdomain mobile.processing.org is launched! This site documents and presents the Mobile Processing initiative from Francis Li.
Processing (BETA) 92 is released.
New software from Aaron Koblin and Zai Chang added to the exhibition.
New Libraries from JohnG, Markavian, and Christian Riekoff.
New Library from Jeffrey Traer Bernstein.
New software from Carolin Horn added to the exhibition.
New software from ART+COM added to the exhibition.
Processing (BETA) 96 Released.
Processing (BETA) 97 Released.
Processing (BETA) 98 Released.
New Libraries from Michael Chang (loading SVG paths) and Christian Riekoff (game controller input).
